text: Rabot Island is an island long and wide, lying south of Renaud Island in the Biscoe Islands. First charted by the French Antarctic Expedition, 1903–05, under Jean-Baptiste Charcot, who named it for Charles Rabot. Originally discovered by John Biscoe. == See also == * List of Antarctic islands south of 60° S ==References== == External links == * Category:Islands of the Biscoe Islands
title: Rabot Island
